result.execSummary:
The defendant Leon Yeej Yang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence; Huber privileges to apply for work
Contact the Probation and Parole Office within 24 hours from today

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample within 72 hours of today and pay the DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges payable in one year. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
- Restitution set at zero.

- No violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
- No use or possession of alcohol and subject to random drug tests. 
- No use or possession of weapons or firearms.
- NO CONTACT with VKV.
- Complete an AODA assessment; Mental Health Assessment; and comply with any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: STRAIGHT TIME; IMPOSED AND STAYED; for use of the Agent's discretion

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon Yeej Yang

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve FIVE MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, with credit for THREE DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Contact the Probation and Parole Office WITHIN 24 HOURS FROM TODAY.  
-Serve 30 DAYS of condition time in the House of Correction -- STRAIGHT TIME -- IMPOSED AND STAYED FOR USE OF THE AGENT'S DISCRETION. 
-No violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
-No use or possession of alcohol and subject to random drug tests. 
-No use or possession of weapons or firearms.
-No contact with VKV.
-Complete an AODA assessment, mental health assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.
-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges PAYABLE IN ONE YEAR. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample WITHIN 72 HOURS OF TODAY and pay the DNA surcharge.
-Restitution set at zero.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Leon Yeej Yang in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Leon Yeej Yang.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury trial (first call). Case is no longer in trial posture. Defense requests to resolve the case through a plea and sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

AS TO COUNT 2  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Sentencing to proceed.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report Received and Filed.

Defendant Leon Yeej Yang in Court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in Court for Leon Yeej Yang.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Court addressed Motions in Limine, Witness Lists, and Jury Instructions. Court issued a Sequestration Order. No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 15. Jury Trial scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Leon Yeej Yang in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Leon Yeej Yang in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leon Yeej Yang appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is re-assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10 due to nature of case.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
